unnormalised: **Auto Buzz: New Wheels Hit the Indian Roads!**
normalised: Greetings auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing with fresh launches this week. Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much-awaited "Bajarang", a compact S U V aimed squarely at the youth. Early reports suggest mileage figures around twenty five kilometer per liter.

unnormalised: Namaste auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing with fresh launches this week. Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much-awaited "Bajarang", a compact SUV aimed squarely at the youth. Early reports suggest mileage figures around 25 kmpl.
normalised: Tata Motors also jumped into the fray, showcasing its revamped "Indica E V two point zero" at the Auto Expo in Greater Noida. Doctor Sen, Head of Innovation at Tata, promised a range of four hundred kilometer on a single charge. Pre-bookings are already open!

unnormalised: Tata Motors also jumped into the fray, showcasing its revamped "Indica Ev2.0" at the Auto Expo in Greater Noida. Dr. Sen, Head of Innovation at Tata, promised a range of 400 km on a single charge. Pre-bookings are already open!
normalised: Not to be left behind, Mahindra has teased a rugged off-roader, codenamed "The Thar's Cousin", expected to launch around Diwali. Rumors suggest it will come with a spacious interior boasting over one hundred and fifty square feet of cargo space.

unnormalised: Not to be left behind, Mahindra has teased a rugged off-roader, codenamed "The Thar's Cousin", expected to launch around Diwali. Rumors suggest it will come with a spacious interior boasting over 150 sq ft of cargo space.
normalised: And for those with deeper pockets, B M W India launched the M five Competition, priced at a cool rupee one point eight crore. So, get ready to empty those wallets folks! Happy driving (responsibly, of course!).

unnormalised: And for those with deeper pockets, BMW India launched the M5 Competition, priced at a cool Rs. 1.8 Cr. So, get ready to empty those wallets folks! Happy driving (responsibly, of course!).
